<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#sort>

The example actually uses the `blog_recent_posts` .
Then simple add the attribute to sort by, could be `created_date` (I don’t remember if it’s this systemname exactly, you can check by outputting the loop itself, which attributes you can sort from).
Use the `reverse` boolean to grab from the oldest first.

Thanks <@UCBDLK6SU>
I was wondering if there is a way to sort the listing on the blog index (_`templateType: blog_listing`)_
Since there I get  the content and pagination number and other data such as:
`contents`
`current_page_num`
`total_page_count`
etc

Using the sort you mentioned, I would have to re-do the entire listing, with tags/categories and what not.
Also the blog_recent_posts also has a limit I thing

I understand.
That may not be possible.
You can check what `contents` gives you, and possibly sort on that one?
I’m almost always building out a module to handle blog posts, even on listing pages.

I think you could just use the |reverse filter? Though I haven't tested if it works properly with pagination.

```{% for content in contents|reverse %}{% endfor %}```
Thanks <@U39DT5YFL>, I’ve tried it. All it does is reverses my current page :disappointed:
